# Satya Nadella‚Äôs Post

[!\[\]()](https://www.linkedin.com/in/satyanadella?trk=public_post_feed-actor-image)

[Satya Nadella](https://www.linkedin.com/in/satyanadella?trk=public_post_feed-actor-name)

Satya Nadella is an Influencer

Chairman and CEO at Microsoft

22h

- [Report this post](/uas/login?session_redirect=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.linkedin.com%2Fposts%2Fsatyanadella_microsoft-incorporates-openais-gpt-5-into-activity-7359268389866913793-jI2m&trk=public_post_ellipsis-menu-semaphore-sign-in-redirect&guestReportContentType=POST&_f=guest-reporting)

Today, GPT-5 launches across our platforms, including Microsoft 365 Copilot, Copilot, GitHub Copilot, and Azure AI Foundry. It's the most capable model yet from our partners at OpenAI, bringing powerful new advances in reasoning, coding, and chat, all trained on Azure.

It‚Äôs hard to believe it‚Äôs only been two and a half years since Sam Altman joined us in Redmond to show the world GPT-4 for the first time in Bing, and it‚Äôs incredible to see how far we‚Äôve come since that moment.

The pace of progress is only accelerating, and I can‚Äôt wait to see what developers, enterprises, and consumers will do with this latest breakthrough. [https://lnkd.in/gQHJBHex](https://www.linkedin.com/redir/redirect?url=https%3A%2F%2Flnkd%2Ein%2FgQHJBHex&urlhash=URmR&trk=public_post-text)

#GPT-5 release is a clear signal that we‚Äôre entering a new era where reasoning, creativity, and code converge at unprecedented scale.

It‚Äôs been an amazing week!

The integration across Microsoft 365, [GitHub](https://www.linkedin.com/company/github?trk=public_post_comment-text) and Azure AI Foundry means this breakthrough won‚Äôt be confined to labs, it will empower everyday workflows, development environments, and enterprise decisions in real time.

What we‚Äôre witnessing is more just acceleration. A profound transformation.

And who is paying for it? Subcribers forced into increased monthly MSFT software installments without being given an effective choice. This is known as rentier capitalism. Yes it‚Äôs new, it‚Äôs high tech and like all high tech (to quote) it‚Äôs neither good nor bad nor is it neutral. So let‚Äôs not go crazy. Not all high tech is net good. Social media is arguably net bad. The real challenge is how to extract the social benefits and minimise the social costs.
